function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Insufficient ventilation due to conflicting guidelines on CO2 concentration and airflow","Impact":"Increased risk of virus spread and infection in indoor environments","Mitigation":"Harmonize ventilation guidelines and ensure proper airflow and CO2 concentration levels are maintained","Technologies":"Advanced HVAC systems with CO2 sensors and variable airflow controls","People":"Occupants of buildings, especially in densely populated areas","Owner":"Health and building authorities"},{"Description":"Inadequate temperature and humidity control leading to virus persistence","Impact":"Increased likelihood of virus survival and transmission in indoor spaces","Mitigation":"Implement precise temperature and humidity control within recommended ranges","Technologies":"Smart HVAC systems with temperature and humidity sensors and controls","People":"Occupants, building designers, and HVAC system operators","Owner":"Building owners, designers, and facility management"},{"Description":"Limited understanding of virus deactivation requirements for HVAC systems","Impact":"Potential inability to effectively deactivate the virus in indoor air and surfaces","Mitigation":"Conduct further research to determine precise temperature and humidity thresholds for virus inactivation","Technologies":"Advanced virus detection and deactivation technologies within HVAC systems","People":"Researchers, HVAC engineers, and building designers","Owner":"Research institutions, HVAC companies, and building design firms"}]}
